intro: Mathewsia matthioloides, commonly known as the sand matthiola, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its small, fragrant white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
